info.name: vSphere Automation REST Resources
info.description: The folders within this collection represent the Rest API resources and the different operations that can be performed on each. These are individual requests. In many cases, each request will require input that would come from other requests. It is left up to the user to insert the correct data into the URL, query parameters and request bodies for the requests to work correctly. Refer to the ReST API Documentation for further help.

item.name: Authentication

exec: tests["Response time is less than 1000ms"] = responseTime < 1000;

request.description: Login to the specified vCenter and retrieve a session

exec: tests["Response time is less than 1000ms"] = responseTime < 1000;

header.description: The SAML bearer token must be gzipped and base64 encoded before using it.

request.description: Login to the specified vCenter and retrieve a session using a SAML bearer token. The SAML bearer token _must_ be gzipped and base64 encoded before being used.

exec: tests["Response time is less than 1000ms"] = responseTime < 1000;

request.description: Logout of the specified vCenter

item.description: This collection of requests shows how to log in and log out.

request.description: This request will list all the datacenters.
This call will find the Testbed-DC datacenter created in the setup sample
List the details of the specified datacenter.
Delete the specified datacenter.
Create a new datacenter. Specify the name and the folder for the datacenter to be created in as part of the request body.
List Datastores
Find Datastores with given filter details

item.name: List details for a single datastore

request.description: List details for a datastore
List Folder IDs
Find Folders with given filter details

item.name: Hosts

request.description: List all the hosts available.
Add a new host to the specified folder
Connect a disconnected host
Disconnect a connected host
Remove the specified standalone host

item.description: The requests in this collection can be called independently. Each request may require various bits of data such as the host name.

request.description: This request will get the list of all networks available.

This call will return a list of resource pools

item.name: VM

request.description: List all available VMs
Get the details for the specified VM
Find a VM based on the specified filter, in this case the vm name when it was created.
Create a new VM with the bare minimum properties. All other properties will use sensible defaults.
Delete the specified VM

item.description: The requests in this collection can be called independently. Each request may require various bits of data such as the vm id or name, etc.

item.name: Find folers to create the VM in

request.description: This request can be called to get a list of folders. To create a VM, we need the datastore and vm folders. If not previously captured during the /datacenter/<datacenter-name> details, the response can be parsed for the vm and datastore folders.
This request will create a VM using the environment variables for storage, resource pool and folder.

item.description: This set of requests will show how to add a VM to an existing datacenter created in the setup process.
